comment.author: 45629840@N03
comment._content:
Sixth child from the right on the back row is Thomas Clifford McDill.  Later in life he played on the 1899 Miami football team.  As a young Miami business man he is pictured in a later photograph in this collection selling Coca-Cola from a stand during an Oxford Stree Fair.
During the 1950's "Cliff", as he was known, was Oxford police officer.   His son, Thomas Kapp McDill, became a WWII P-51 fighter pilot with the 4th Fighter Group.
